title: Seth Tuttle
text:
Seth Tuttle (born September 5, 1992) is an American former <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player and current assistant coach for the <a href="Northern%20Iowa%20Panthers%20men%27s%20basketball">Northern Iowa Panthers</a>. He had an <a href="NCAA%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20All-Americans">All-American</a> college career at Northern Iowa (UNI). Tuttle was considered one of the top college players in the country, and was a midseason finalist for the <a href="Naismith%20College%20Player%20of%20the%20Year">Naismith College Player of the Year</a> award.
College career.
Tuttle, a 6'8"(2.03 m) <a href="Forward%20%28basketball%29">forward</a> from West Fork High School in <a href="Sheffield%2C%20Iowa">Sheffield, Iowa</a>, came to UNI in 2011. He chose the Panthers over larger schools such as <a href="Iowa%20Hawkeyes%20men%27s%20basketball">Iowa</a>, <a href="Iowa%20State%20Cyclones%20men%27s%20basketball">Iowa State</a> and <a href="Wisconsin%20Badgers%20men%27s%20basketball">Wisconsin</a> after leading West Fork to four straight conference titles. In his first season, he became the first freshman in <a href="Missouri%20Valley%20Conference">Missouri Valley Conference</a> (MVC) history to lead the league in <a href="field%20goal%20percentage">field goal percentage</a> (.652) and was named the conference Freshman of the Year. In his junior season, he became one of the top players in the MVC, averaging 15.4 <a href="Points%20per%20game">points</a> and 8.0 <a href="rebounds%20per%20game">rebounds per game</a>. He was named first-team All-MVC.
In Tuttle's senior season, he was named to the preseason All-MVC team. After leading the Panthers to a 24–2 start and a national ranking, Tuttle was named one of 30 finalists nationally for the <a href="Naismith%20College%20Player%20of%20the%20Year">Naismith College Player of the Year</a> award, and one of 10 finalists for the John R. Wooden Award.
Professional career.
In June 2015 Tuttle signed to play for the <a href="Miami%20Heat">Miami Heat</a> in the <a href="NBA%20Summer%20League">NBA Summer League</a>. On July 24 he signed an annual contract with <a href="s.Oliver%20Baskets">s.Oliver Baskets</a> of the <a href="Basketball%20Bundesliga">Basketball Bundesliga</a>.
On July 27, 2016, <a href="Limburg%20United">Limburg United</a> of the <a href="Basketball%20League%20Belgium%20Division%20I">Basketball League Belgium Division I</a> announced that they had signed Tuttle for the 2016–17 season.
On June 6, 2017, Tuttle was announced by <a href="Spirou%20Charleroi">Spirou Charleroi</a>.
Coaching career.
In 2018, Tuttle returned to his alma mater, Northern Iowa, joining the coaching staff as a graduate assistant. Prior to the 2020–21 season, he was promoted to video coordinator. He served in that position for one season before he was again promoted to an assistant coach.
